text.p: French holding group CGIP said it did not deny a market rumour that it was the seller in a market placement of a four percent stake in information technology group Cap Gemini.
"We do not deny that," a company spokesman said.
CGIP chairman Ernest-Antoine Seilliere said on Tuesday during a news conference on the company's acquisition of a 20 percent stake in car parts group Valeo that the holding could sell some assets.
He noted that he considered a 20 percent stake in Cap Gemini as "strategic" but not a stake bigger than that.
CGIP had a 23.4 percent stake in Cap Gemini and CGIP's parent company Marine-Wendel had 0.7 percent.
Market sources said HSBC James Capel and Merrill Lynch had been placing 2.4 million shares in Cap Gemini at a price of 230 to 235 francs.
At 1131 GMT, Cap Gemini was 1.1 percent lower at 243.30 francs after having hit a day low of 237 francs.
